question: Which financial institution has allocated USD 20 million to help developing countries in accessing Covid-19 vaccine?
explanation:
The Asian Development Bank (ADB) recently announced that it has allocated USD 20.3 million aid to its developing member countries to access coronavirus vaccine.
The funds include USD 20 million from ADBâ€™s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF) and USD 300,000 from the High-Level Technology Fund financed by Japan. Earlier in April, ADB had approved USD 20 billion assistance package to help its developing members fight Covid-19.
